COMPANY. LIMITED. South America, East, South and West Africa, India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan. For latest average time .to London, see daily bulletin in this paper.
STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo; Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-SaYd, Suakin. Head Office. London. Peninsular and Oriental S. N. Company. Summer Rates will be charged from 2 May to 31 October. For the convenience of families and others,a largo portion of each ship’s accommodation has been reserved for Egypt, so that Berths can be definitely engaged at once, as if the voyage were commencing at Port Said. Plans can be set n at-the Offices of tho Company's Agents. The through Steamers for Marseilles and London are intended to leave Port Said after th'e arrival of the 11 a.m. train from Cairo, eve Monday until Juno, and then every Tuesday. A steam tender will meet tho train to convey passengers to tho ship. Caledonia..... 8 May I Arabia ........ 6 June I Egypt............. 4 July Moldavia........ 15 „ Himalaya....... 13 „ Britannia......11 Macedonia....... 22 „ Persia .........20 „ Caledonia......18 „ Victoria ... 29/30 „ | India...........27 „ | Mongolia.......25
The Brindisi Express Steamers leave Port Said directly the Indian Mails arrive. Passengers can go on board the evening before. The Fare remains as usual. For all further information apply to the Company’s Agents, Messrs. Tnos. Cook & Son (Egypt) Ltd.................. CAIRO. Oeoroe Royle, Esq..................................... PORT-SAID. Messrs.; Haselden & Co. ... ... -..................... ALEXANDRIA. F. Q. DAVIDSON, Superintendent P. & 0.8. N. Company in Egypt 8UEZ.

KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE. FAST BRITISH PASSENGER STEAMERS. GREECE - TURKEY UNE. Express steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIR2EU8, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London. PALESTINE - SYRIA UNE.
Fast steamors leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazaroth), BEYROUT (for Damasous), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weoks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus). red SEA UNE.
Steamers leave Suoz fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSO- WAH, HODEIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and 8UAKIM direct Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required. N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free. Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company's Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at Thor Cook & Son or other Tourist Agency. 31-12-904

Oook’s Interpreters in uniform are present at the principal Railway statiions and Landing-planes in Europe to assist passengers holding their travel ing tickets.
